description: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is requesting Industry feedback regarding potential solutions which meet the Naval Inshore Support Vessel (NISV) project operational requirements as listed in the Annex A and Appendixes provided herewith. \\(The requirements as described in the attached annexes will be fulfilled for Government of Canada on behest of the Department of National Defence. \\(The objectives of this RFI are to:\a. Apprise potential bidders of the requirements of this project;\nb. Collect information regarding the technical feasibility of the requirements as published in this document. \\(c. Seek industry feedback on potential solutions to the operational requirements described in ANNEX A. \\(d. Seek costing information from industry for budgetary purposes; and\e. Engage potential bidders and answer their questions as necessary. \\(The project will meet these objectives by requesting respondents to complete the Industry Response Template in ANNEX B. \\(This RFI is neither a call for tender nor a request for proposal (RFP).  No agreement or contract will be entered into based on this RFI.  The issuance of this RFI is not to be considered in any way a commitment by the Government of Canada, nor as authority to potential respondents to undertake any work that could be charged to Canada. \\(This RFI is not to be considered as a commitment to issue a subsequent solicitation or award any contract(s) for the work described herein. Canada does not intend to award any contract on the basis of this notice or otherwise pay for the information solicited. Any and all expenses incurred by the Respondent in pursuing this opportunity, including the provision of information and potential visits, are at the Respondent's sole risk and expense. \\(Any discussions on this subject with project staff representing Department of National Defence, Public Services and Procurement Canada, Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada or any other Government of Canada representative or other personnel involved in project activities, must not be construed as an offer to purchase or as a commitment by Canada.')
duration_in_months: These is no duration. This is a one-time RFI.
full_summary:
### Request for Information: Naval Inshore Support Vessels

**Procurement Reference Number**: PW-__MC-031-28863
**Solicitation Number**: W8472-225864/A
**Amendment Number**: 1
**Date of Publication**: November 25, 2022
**Closing Date and Time**: September 1, 2023 at 2:00:00 PM (EST)

## Description

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) invites interested suppliers to provide feedback on potential solutions that meet the operational requirements for the Naval Inshore Support Vessels (NISV) project. The project, as described in Appendix A, aims to support the Department of National Defence.

## Objective

The objectives of this Request for Information (RFI) are to:

* Apprise potential bidders of the project requirements
* Collect information on the technical feasibility of the requirements
* Seek industry feedback on potential solutions to the operational requirements
* Gather costing information for budgetary purposes
* Engage potential bidders and address their questions

## Submission Requirements

* Industry Response Template in Annex B
* Responses may be submitted in either official language of Canada

## Important Notes

Not considered a call for tender or a request for proposal (RFP)
No agreement or contract will be entered into based on this RFI
No reimbursement of costs incurred by participating in this RFI
Not considered a commitment to issue a subsequent solicitation or award a contract
Not necessary to participate in this RFI for future solicitations
Property submitted may be disclosed in accordance with the Access to Information and Privacy Act
All expenses incurred by the Respondent in pursuing this opportunity are at the Respondent's sole risk and expense

## Contracting Entity

Department of National Defence on behalf of the Government of Canada

## Contact Information

Jeremy Langdon
Contact Person
Phone: (613) 220-8146
Email: jeremy.langdon@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Note: You have to rewrite all the content except for the government documentation numbers and dates. Remember that a RFI (Request for Information) allows potential bidders to give initial feedback and is a pre-requisite before issuing the formal public open bid. Make the text format clean and readable, with clear layout.
There are parts where the input is definitely confusing and difficult to follow. Here are some areas requiring improvements:

*   Use standard language that a well-educated English or French speaker can easily comprehend.
*
